page.title: 20WOOLROW FARM
page.content: Mr Hall has been at this farm for twenty five years.The main crop is grass.From his cows he gets 350 gallons a day of milk.He also sells potatoes.They make little money with eggs as they eat most themselves. There are twelve hens and two or three cocks.The house was built in the twelfth century, but a stone on one side is dated 1718.It used to be called The Wolf Trap and the name has changed through the years to Woolrow. The farm has seven acres of woodland and 90 acres of grassland; root crops are grown in 10 acres,there are five acres of swedes and 2 acres of kale. They start working on the farm at 7 o'clock in the morning.
